programme.title: Day Of The Dragon
programme.desc: The clock starts just before sunrise - when the temperature begins to rise. It‚Äôs hard work being the world‚Äôs biggest lizard on Rinca island. programme.title: Killer Shark Vs. Killer Whale
programme.desc: Killer Shark vs. Killer Whale examined an extraordinary incident that occurred at the Farallon Islands, 27 miles off San Francisco, in October 1997. Two killer whales attacked and drowned a great white shark and ripped out its liver. The incident left biologists mystified. Since then there have been more attacks internationally. What is happening between the two apex predators of the oceans?

programme.title: The Hidden Kingdoms Of China
programme.desc: China's vast grasslands are a hard place to survive. Battered by ferocious and unpredictable storms throughout the year, the inhabitants of these grasslands have to be adaptable and tenacious to survive. During the short three-month window of summer, the plains residents have to race against time to raise their young before the onset of autumn and winter begin.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: From a harrowing farrowing to an emergency kidding, the vets pull off miracles! There‚Äôs no pause in paws as Dr. Brenda and Dr. Lisa treat a variety of foot injuries, including a Sheltie with broken toes. Dr. Pol examines a massive mastiff with tummy trouble and an injured rabbit. The Pol family add a pregnant Friesian mare to the herd and Dr. Nicole has her hands full with a rooster and a cat.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: From quirky to jaw dropping, Pol Vets see it all! A cat‚Äôs wounded eye hides a surprise, an odd duck has trouble laying eggs, a docile donkey suffers a sore hoof, and a prized goat breaks her leg. Dr. Pol starts the day right with 26 puppy health checks, Dr. Lisa solves a case of a missing tail and Dr. Nicole goes grub hunting.

programme.title: Critter Fixers: Country Vets
programme.desc: The Docs at Critter Fixer help a first-time dog owner with puppies and aid an achy peacock. Dr. Hodges attempts to remove gigantic bladder stones from a tiny dog, help a guinea pig with labored breathing, treat the snouts of some hognose snakes, and fix an adolescent groundhog at a rescue. The docs fly in to perform a rare amputation on an owl.

programme.title: Heartland Docs, DVM
programme.desc: Dr. Ben diagnoses a pet rat with the sniffles, and when a goat has a stinky situation Dr. Erin gets to the bottom of it!
